page.title: 09FISHING IN SELSEY
page.content: Selsey has been famous as a fishing village for centuries.In the centre of East Beach are the fisherman's huts, an untidy group of tar_pitched wooden shacks,nets,lobster pots,small punts.Some of the fishermen have joined together to form a syndicate and operate the larger boats which ride at anchor opposite the huts between February and November.The fishermen mainly catch lobsters,prawns and crabs but also a variety of different fish including skate,plaice and mackerel sometimes.Winkles are found in the sea area to the North.They breed on the salt marsh and gradually move down. The best beds are just off_shore and this area is known locally as the Winkle Beds.
